title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Jane Goodall, famed primatologist, changed the way we thought about apes
items.description: The scientist and conservationist made waves with her observations and advocacy

items.title: Renowned U.S. climate center trims staff ahead of expected budget cuts
items.description: NSF-funded National Center for Atmospheric Research is already shuttered during shutdown

items.title: New radioactive isotope therapies promise more targeted attacks on cancer
items.description: Recent clinical successes, and profits, have prompted a rush among pharma companies to try new isotopes and targeting strategies

items.title: Neurons can communicate via hidden network of nanotubes, study finds
items.description: Tubes in mouse and human brains may also influence spread of brain disease

items.title: Made to order bioweapon? AI-designed toxins slip through safety checks used by companies selling genes
items.description: Researchers expose flaws in safeguards intended to block rogue actors from making bioweapons

items.title: Could technology reduce fractures in racehorses?
items.description: AI promises advance warnings, and mathematical models point to a simple prevention strategy

items.title: After months in limbo, four NIH institute directors fired
items.description: Two leaders removed by Trump administration had hoped to stay at agency as in-house investigators

items.title: Wildfire smoke is charring your wine. This microbe could help
items.description: Bacteria already living on grapes can break down smoky chemicals that wreck flavor

items.title: AI reveals vast ‘ghost forests’ along U.S. coast
items.description: Machine learning method counts nearly 12 million dead trees, many likely killed by rising seas

items.title: China launches ambitious collaboration to map primate brains—including ours
items.description: 25-year plan will tap brain-mapping prowess in two dozen countries to visualize the organ in unprecedented detail
